programme.title: Dr Xand's Con or Cure S1
programme.desc: The dangers of health tourism - when surgery abroad goes wrong.

programme.title: Iolo's Borderlands S1 (2/4)
programme.desc: Iolo Williams discovers the amazing wildlife of Radnorshire in the Welsh Marches.

programme.title: MasterChef S19
programme.desc: It's the fourth quarter-final, and this week's most talented four cooks return to fight for a place in Knockout Week. They face just one intense challenge. They must cook two courses that will excite not just John and Gregg, but also some of MasterChef's most inspiring winners, finalists and contestants, who have all gone on to careers in the food industry. Their fate is in the hands of two MasterChef champions - from 2020, Thomas Frake, and from 2010, Dhruv Baker - and the finalist from 2021, Alexina Anatole. With just two Knockout Week places up for grabs, these amateurs need to show real flair and ambition to edge closer to the MasterChef 2023 trophy.

programme.title: This is BBC Two
programme.desc: Highlights of programmes on BBC Two.

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer S26 (24/30)
programme.desc: Featuring properties in Cornwall, County Durham and south Wales.

programme.title: Money for Nothing S14 (3/20)
programme.desc: Sarah Moore explores a recycling centre, determined to save items from being crushed.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Frances Tophill reveals some exciting news. After years of dreaming, she finally has her very own garden and can't wait to share her plans and get to grips with bringing this compact space to life. Toby Buckland meets a man who has planted his plot with a wonderful array of fruit and nuts, and there's a gardener in Gloucestershire who is potty about the 500 pot plants she has designed specially to produce a floral firework display. In west London, a community champion is growing a range of unusual produce in the heart of an urban jungle. And there are also more inspiring viewers' videos.

programme.title: Nicky Campbell BBC News Talk
programme.desc: Nicky Campbell takes your calls on the day's talking points, hearing views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 between 9am and 11am on weekdays (calls are free from mobiles and landlines).

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: Twenty-four hours a day, the latest national and international stories as they break.

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: Highlights of the week's proceedings at Westminster and the regional governments.

programme.title: Impossible S5
programme.desc: Game show in which players must avoid giving impossible answers to a set of questions.

programme.title: Eggheads S20
programme.desc: Teams from all over the UK battle to beat the formidable Eggheads.

programme.title: Eat Well for Less? S6
programme.desc: For the very first time, Gregg and Chris help a household of students.

programme.title: Secret Britain (Northern Ireland) S3 (4/4)
programme.desc: «Northern Ireland»The team heads to Northern Ireland.

programme.title: Mission déco S3 (5/8)
programme.desc: The designers each transform a shepherd's hut on a glamping site in north Wales.

programme.title: Flog It ! S15
programme.desc: Paul Martin revisits some of the locations visited by Flog It! and presents all-new valuations. Experts touch down at Bletchley Park, the Ulster Transport Museum and Crowcombe Court to track down some unusual items to sell at auction. They uncover a beautiful watercolour and some stunning porcelain, and Paul Martin visits Antony in Cornwall to unearth a fascinating family history.

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games S5
programme.desc: Every day this week, celebrity contestants Nabil Abdulrashid, Luke Kempner, Sarah Millican and Philippa Perry take on a series of quiz rounds selected by the host, quiz legend Richard Osman. A daily winner is declared following a quickfire round at the end of each show, and the scores are tallied across the week, resulting in an overall champion being crowned on Friday. Will the winning stars opt for the much-coveted House of Games wheelie luggage, or will they be tempted by the House of Games reusable coffee mug, which is brand new for this series?

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip (Conegliano) S1 (15/15)
programme.desc: «Conegliano»Clive heads to the foothills of the Alps to track down the world's best prosecco.

programme.title: Villages by the Sea (Botallack)
programme.desc: «Botallack»Archaeologist Ben Robinson uncovers a poisonous trade in the Cornish village of Botallack.

programme.title: Beechgrove Garden
programme.desc: Beechgrove Garden is planning for a colourful summer this week, planting for pollinators and caring for dahlias both on the programme. Kirsty Wilson and Lizzie Schofield will have the usual half hour of great gardening advice including a follow-up on how the dahlia tubers planted in pots in April are coming on, and what to do if you want to get some free plants by taking dahlia cuttings. Kirsty is sowing a bed around the viburnum that was moved last autumn, this new area will be home to plants particularly good for pollinators. Calum Clunie will be sending an update from his allotment in Fife and George Anderson is in Sunny Joppa. All that plus the start of a garden renovation for a family who has recently moved into a new build house that needs a new garden.

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: With the risk of frost passed, Monty is busy planting out tropical gingers and tomatoes and direct sowing beans. Joe Swift visits a stunning walled garden in Denbighshire, designed and planted by owners who love to recycle and repurpose as much as they can. Rekha Mistry shares the secrets of her success for growing aubergines on her London allotment. There's another visit to farmer-turned-nurseryman Barry Proctor as he makes final preparations for his first RHS Chelsea Flower Show. And to coincide with Mental Health Awareness Week, journalist Rosie Kinchen tells us how horticulture helped her deal with postnatal depression. Plus more of the films that have been sent in by viewers.

programme.title: Hidden Treasures of the National Trust S1 (2/6)
programme.desc: Inside the homes and hidden lives of writers Rudyard Kipling and Vita Sackville-West.

programme.title: Detectorists S3 (5/6)
programme.desc: Andy and Lance become eco-warriors when they find a beloved oak tree is due to be felled.

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories. With Faisal Islam.

programme.title: MOTDx
programme.desc: Jermaine Jenas brings you the best of football culture.

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting S1 (1/4)
programme.desc: Twenty-two thousand fans are in Las Vegas for a celebration of country music.
